descript.abstract: This coverage includes all Public, Private, and Non-accredited PK-12 schools in Iowa. Also included are OTHER school programs including Specially Approved Schools; an Indian Contract School; and schools governed by the Board of Regents, Department of Corrections, and Department of Human Services. The schools included inThis coverage, their locations, and associated attribute information were taken from the "Iowa Educational Directory: 1998-99 School Year" published by the Iowa Department of Education.
descript.purpose: This digital, geographically referenced data set was developed by the Iowa Department of Natural Resources to carry out agency responsibilities related to management, protection, and development of Iowa's natural resources.
descript.supplinf:
Attribute data for this coverage was derived from Microsoft Excel files which are the digital equivalent of the
1998-99 Educational Directory published by the Iowa Department of Education. The Excel files were downloaded from the Department of Education's website at http://www.state.ia.us/educate/gensrch/.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

horizpa.horizpar:
The Point Attribute Table contains a "Method Accuracy Description" field named "Loc_Method". Below are the estimated positional accuracies for each method followed by the number of schools located by that method.
DRG: +/- 25 meters (876)
Flood Affected Area: +/- 25 meters (869)
Address Geocode: +/- 150 meters (93)
911 Address & Plat Map: +/- 150 meters (2)
Bad Locational Info: Undetermined (26)
Street Only: Undetermined (2)
DRG = School represented on DRG (scanned USGS 7.5' Quadrangle map)
Flood Affected Area = See "References" section
The following Method Descriptions refer to instances where the school was not represented on the DRG.
Address Geocode = Geocoded using 1:100,000 scale TIGER line file data from the U.S. Bureau of the Census.
911 Address & Plat map = Geocoded using paper E911 county maps with county plat maps used as verification.
Bad Locational Info = School positioned near the center of the city used in the school's mailing address. Address information provided was not adequate to determine an actual location for the school.
Street Only: Address range data not available for the street so school location placed on an arbitrary position along the street.

lineage.srcinfo:
Attribute data is derived from the 1998-99 Educational Directory for the Iowa Department of Education:
Media: Published Report
Title: Iowa Educational Directory: 1998-99 School Year
Author/Agency: Iowa Department of Education
Published Date: 1998
Locations for 869 schools were taken from a point coverage created by the Rock Island District of the US Army Corps of Engineers following the floods of 1993. The coverage includes all schools listed in the "Iowa Educational Directory: 1993-94 School Year" that occur within the scope of the FEMA-Iowa-GIS project. Following is the metadata for that point coverage:
FILENAME: ia_schools
DOCUMENTATION DATE:May 13, 1994
DATA THEME: SCHOOL
DESCRIPTION: Point coverage showing location of schools within the scope of FEMA-Iowa-GIS project.
ABSTRACT: The schools coverage consists of point locations manually digitized from 1:24K USGS
Quadrangles. Attribute data is derived from dBase III file which is the database equivalent of the
1993-94 Educational Directory for the Iowa Department of Education.
STATUS: 100% complete.
GEOGRAPHIC AREA: Mississippi, Missouri, Cedar, Des Moines, Iowa, Nishebotna, Sioux and Skunk River
corridors in Iowa.
MAP PROJECTIONS: UTM zone 15
MAP UNITS: meters
DATUM: NAD27
SOFTWARE VERSION: ARC/INFO v.6.1.1
INTENDED USE OF DATA: This data set is intended to be used to geographically locate schools and provide
necessary information needed to contact these
schools.
LIMITATIONS OF DATA: The coverage depicts the schools as a single point location. Frequently a school
consists of more than one structure. Frequently a school (especially the Community Colleges) consists of
more than one structure.
COVERAGE DEVELOPERS: Robert Willhite, Steve Lindmark
CONTACT:
Name: Robert Willhite, CENCR-PM-M
Address: U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
Rock Island District
Clock Tower Building
P.O. Box 2004
Rock Island, IL 61204-2004
Phone Number: (309)794-5393
Fax Number: (309)794-5710
E-Mail Address: robert@ncrsun1.ncr.usace.army.mil
robert.a.willhite@usace.army.mil
ORIGINAL SOURCE INFORMATION:
Media: Pager Map 3-dBase III files provided on
1 floppy disk DIR9394.DBF SCHLKITC.DBF
CROSWALK.DBF
Author/Agency: U.S. Geological Survey, Iowa
Department of Education, Census Data Center
Published Dates: 1948-1993 1993
Scale: 1:24,000
Projection: State plane
PROCEDURE USED TO CREATE THE DATA: The corners of each Quadrangle were used as
tics. Tics generated in Lat-Long coordinates. Tics and points then manually digitized from Quadrangles
assigning a unique label-id to each school. Digitized Quadrangles were then appended. The resulting
coveerage was then
transformed to UTM coordinate system. The dBase files were converted to comma delimited ascii format and
converted to an Info table. The Info table and point coverage were then joined with joinitem command
using the label id as the related item.
REVISIONS MADE TO DATA: N/A
REVIEWS APPLIED TO THE DATA:
REFERENCES:
COMMENTS:
NOTICE: The U.S. Army Corps of Engineers assumes no responsibility for errors
in the information. Similarly the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers assumes no
responsibility for the consequences of inappropriate uses or interpretations
of the data made by anyone to whom this data has been made available. The
Corps bears no responsibility to inform users of any changes made to this
data. Anyone using this data is advised that precision implied by the
coverage may far exceed actual precision. Comments on this data are invited
and the Corps would appreciate that documented errors be brought to staff
attention.
POINT ATTRIBUTE FILE ITEMS (PAT)
ATTRIBUTE DESCRIPTION
ia_schools_id Unique label identification number
aea Area Education Agency number
county Iowa has 99 counties. They are numbered 1-99 in alphabetical order. See Iowa Official
Register 1993-1994
district school district number
nces TIGER Census data school district number
school Building or site number
name Name of school
admin Administrators name
title Administrators title (i.e., Principal)
address Address
city City
zip_code Zip Code
area_code 3 digit area code
phone_# 7 digit phone number
ac2 Area code for fax machine, if applicable
fax Fax machine number, if applicable
gradespan Gradespan
kitchen On site Kitchen y = yes n = no

overview.eaover:
AREA: All equal to 0
Perimeter: All equal to 0
k12schls_: Internal polygon identifier
k12schls_i: User assigned polygon identifier
Sch_code: The code number assigned by the Department of Education to each school.
Loc_method: The method used to locate each school building. The various methods used have different associated positional accuracies. See the section titled "Accuracy Assessment" for details. Schools with an entry of "Flood Affected Area" were taken from a point coverage showing locations of schools within the scope of the FEMA-Iowa -GIS project . The coverage was created by the Rock Island District of the US Army Corps of Engineers following the flood of 1993. The coverage consists of point locations manually digitized from 1:24K USGS Quadrangles. See the References section for metadata concerning this coverage.
Sch_type: The type of school. Valid entries are: Public, Private, Non-accredited (NA), and Other. The "Other" category includes Specially Approved Schools; an Indian Contract School; and schools governed by the Board of Regents, Department of Corrections, and Department of Human Services.
County: The county number where the administrative office for the district is located.
District: The 4-digit code assigned by the Department of Education to identify each school district.
School: The 3-digit code assigned by the Department of Education to identify the building.
Aea: The Area Education Agency (AEA) to which the school belongs.
School_dis: The name of the school district.
School_nam: The name of the school.
Executive: Name and title of the school administrator
Address: School address
City: City portion of school mailing address.
Zip: School zip code
Phone: School phone number.
Fax: School FAX number.
Gradespan: Grade span attending the school. In some cases, two or more schools share a building, but they are represented as seperate point features in this coverage. All attribute information pertain to each uniquely identified school, not necessarily seperate buildings.
Enrollment: The student enrollment and the academic year for which the enrollment figure was provided (text string).
Enroll_num: Student enrollment formatted as a numeric value.None

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

distinfo.distliab: This digital, geographically referenced data set was developed by the Iowa Department of Natural Resources to carry out agency responsibilities related to management, protection, and development of Iowa's natural resources. It resides in the Natural Resources Geographic Information System library. Although efforts have been made to make it useful to the Department, the Department assumes no responsibility for errors in the information. Similarly the Department assumes no responsibility for the consequences of inappropriate uses or interpretations of the data made by anyone to whom this data has been made available. The Department bears no responsibility to inform users of any changes made to this data. Anyone using this data is advised that precision implied by the coverage may far exceed actual precision. Comments on this data are invited and the Department would appreciate that documented errors be brought to staff attention. The development of the coverages in the NRGIS Library represents a major investment of staff time and effort. As a professional responsibility, we expect that the Iowa DNR will receive proper credit when you utilize these GIS coverages and that the original documentation will remain with any redistribution of these coverages.

cntorgp.cntorg: Iowa Department of Natural Resources - Geological Survey
